title: 129th Problem 2016

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can check it out by {MRS GREN} . In this case, lets see the choices:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Movement { Metabolism }
               The legs we have for."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Growth {We grow like our bones develop}"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Reproduction { We have the sexual organs though different in male and female }"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The only thing we don't have is photosynthesis and so it is the answer"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1/2 and 1/3 points
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ABCD"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a square, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"E"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are midpoints of sides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AD"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" respectively,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"DI= IJ=JC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":","}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AB=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":","}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If area of shaded region is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{a}{b}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive co-prime Integers,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/1gRsp7M0k1-sq.png?width=1200"}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Considering that E is the midpoint of AD and F is the midpoint of BC, the length of GH is the average of the length of IJ and AB which is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{\frac{1}{3}+1}{2}=\dfrac{2}{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Note that the perpendicular height of the trapezium is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then the area of the trapezium is as follows:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{2} \times \dfrac{1}{2} \times (\dfrac{2}{3}+1)=\dfrac{1}{4} \times \dfrac{5}{3}= \dfrac{5}{4\times 3}=\dfrac{5}{12}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore as required, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b=5+12=\boxed{17}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 12 Balls
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You have the following collection of brightly colored balls:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/W6fuX41Oqi-4colors.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You put them all in a bag, mix them up and them pick them out (without replacement) one by one."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the probability that the first three you pick will be the same color, the second three will be the same color and the third three you pick will be the same color, is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{a}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then what is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Image credit:  http://www.pd4pic.com/"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The number of ways you can pick out "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"12"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" balls is given by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"12!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The number of ways you can pick them out in groups of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of the same color (as described in the problem) is given by  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(3!)^4 \cdot 4!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(3!)^4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" accounts for the number of ways of arranging similar balls within each group.  The "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" accounts for the number of ways of rearranging the groups themselves."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, the probability you will pick them out as described above is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{(3!)^4 \cdot 4!}{12!} = \frac{1}{\boxed{15400}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
